page.title: 16EDUCATION PAST AND PRESENT
page.content:
In{1673}Nailstone had a master to teach the children, he probably had his school in the church.
In{1828}Earl Howe supported the building of a village school. In{1832} it had 80 children. It was enlarged in 1858.
In{1982}the new Dove Bank Primary School was built for children from Nailstone, Bagworth and Battram. It was built partly from N.C.B. funding following the effects of subsidence on former schools in Bagworth and Battram.
It has just over 100 children in{1985. Children enter school during the term in which they will become five and they transfer to Ibstock High School in the summer after they become eleven
